title: TRIDENT Reference Ontology - JSON Schema Bundle
description: Bundle of canonical TRIDENT artifacts as JSON Schema $defs. Use $ref to validate individual artifact instances.

Identifier.description: Opaque, stable identifier (not a UUID requirement).

CPE.description: Common Platform Enumeration identifier. Hierarchical URI describing a platform/product/version. The convergence point where CVE, CCE, and XCCDF data meet the asset inventory.

part.description: CPE part: a=application, h=hardware, o=operating system

parentCpe.description: Reference to a parent CPE in the hierarchy (e.g., version-less CPE for a versioned entry)

XCCDFChecklist.description: NIST National Checklist Program (NCP) security configuration checklist in XCCDF format. Defines hardening baselines for specific platforms.

controlRefs.description: SP800-53 controls referenced by this checklist's rules

cceRefs.description: CCE identifiers covered by this checklist

source.description: URL to the NCP repository entry or SCAP content

type.description: How the control is realised: product (tool/technology), config (hardening setting), process (operational procedure), or policy (documented requirement)

xccdfRefs.description: XCCDF checklists that define this config implementation

cpeScope.description: CPE identifiers describing which platforms this implementation applies to

affectedCPEs.description: Structured CPE references for affected platforms (supplements freetext affected.product)

PatternContext.description: Structured environmental context for threat-led control selection. References TDCE (data types), TPE (protocols), TCSE (cloud services), TACM (adversary tiers), and THFM (human factors) catalogues.

dataTypes.description: Data types processed by the pattern (TDCE catalogue)

cloudServices.description: Cloud services used by the pattern. Reference a specific TCSE entry (ref) or a provider-agnostic service model (serviceModel).

CognitiveVulnerability.description: THFM cognitive vulnerability class — a human behavioural weakness that adversaries exploit via social engineering or that manifests as insider threat risk. The human equivalent of CWE for software weaknesses.

category.description: Vulnerability category: AU=Authority & Compliance, UR=Urgency & Scarcity, TR=Trust & Rapport, CU=Curiosity & Reward, HB=Habitual & Cognitive Load, IN=Insider Disposition

cialdiniPrinciple.description: Cialdini principle of influence this vulnerability maps to (null for non-Cialdini cognitive biases)

exploitedBy.description: ATT&CK techniques that exploit this cognitive vulnerability

controlRefs.description: SP800-53 controls that mitigate this vulnerability

cisSafeguards.description: CIS Safeguard identifiers that mitigate this vulnerability

insiderStage.description: For IN-category: CERT CPIR stage (0-4) this disposition factor maps to. Null for non-insider categories.

resilienceLevel.description: Organisational resilience maturity: 0=Unaddressed, 1=Aware, 2=Targeted, 3=Measured, 4=Adaptive. Null if not assessed.

VerticalProfile.description: Vertical-specific configuration profile that the TRIDENT derivation engine consumes to scope technique sets, regulatory requirements, and human factor priorities per sub-vertical.

subVerticalProfiles.description: Threat profiles per sub-vertical, derived from TACM §5.2 reference profiles

regulatoryScope.description: Framework IDs mandatory for this sub-vertical

advisoryFrameworks.description: Framework IDs advisory/recommended for this sub-vertical

mandatoryFrameworks.description: Frameworks applying to all entities in this vertical

subVerticalFrameworks.description: Per sub-vertical mandatory frameworks keyed by sub-vertical ID

sectorSpecificNotes.description: Per THFM class ID, sector-specific context

socialEngineeringProfile.description: THFM cognitive vulnerability classes ranked by sector prevalence

corePatterns.description: Pattern IDs most relevant to this vertical

InsiderStage.description: Insider threat progression stage (0-4). Synthesises CERT CPIR, CPNI attack sequence, and Fraud Triangle into a Trident-native insider pathway model.

cisaTypes.description: CISA insider types that can be at this stage

riskFactors.description: THFM-IN disposition factors that indicate this stage

indicators.description: Observable indicators for this stage with detection methods

detectionControls.description: SP800-53 controls and TTCE capabilities that detect this stage

interventionWindow.description: Description of the intervention opportunity at this stage

transitionTrigger.description: What causes progression to the next stage (null for Stage 4 — terminal)

AssuranceProfile.description: NIST SP 800-63 assurance profile indicating maximum supported assurance levels

maxIAL.description: Maximum Identity Assurance Level (IAL1-IAL3) this provider class can support

maxAAL.description: Maximum Authenticator Assurance Level (AAL1-AAL3) this provider class can support

maxFAL.description: Maximum Federation Assurance Level (FAL1-FAL2) this provider class can support

IdentityProvider.description: TIDM identity provider reference class — an architectural role in the enterprise identity graph. Not a product instance (that is CPE/Implementation) but a class of identity infrastructure.

controlRefs.description: SP800-53 control identifiers this provider class satisfies

protocols.description: TPE protocol identifiers used by this provider class

federationRole.description: Typical federation role of this provider class

mfaCapability.description: Whether this provider class supports multi-factor authentication

AccessPolicy.description: TIDM access policy reference class — an architectural pattern of access control policy, not individual policy instances.

controlRefs.description: SP800-53 control identifiers this policy class enforces

techniques.description: ATT&CK technique identifiers this policy class mitigates

cisSafeguards.description: CIS Safeguard identifiers this policy class supports

enforcementPoint.description: Where the policy is evaluated and enforced

IdentityPrincipal.description: TIDM identity principal reference class — a category of identity principal that determines lifecycle, credential management, and risk profile.

controlRefs.description: SP800-53 control identifiers governing this principal class

riskFactors.description: Key risk factors associated with this principal class

FederationPattern.description: TIDM federation pattern reference class — a common federation topology describing how identity providers are connected.

riskProfile.description: Key risk characteristics of this federation topology
